content:
It seems the command was run incorrectly because combining multiple commands without proper separation caused an error "bash: id_rsa_tempchmod: command not found."

I will split the commands correctly on Kali as follows:

1. Create the file with the private key content.
2. Change permissions.
3. Use the key to SSH.

Commands:
echo '<full_private_key_content>' > id_rsa_temp
chmod 600 id_rsa_temp
ssh -i id_rsa_temp user@172.10.0.3

I will do that properly in the Kali terminal now.
